reviews.review: Es extraño de expresar mecanicas sencillas pero existen varias formas de explotarlas ademas de esto existen varios personajes por ende varias formas de jugar. Los ruidos la musica de fondo el ambiente todo va muy acorde esto es independiente de ser superviviente o killer. Una mezcla muy bien diseñada y adictiva.

An sich würde das Spiel Spaß machen wenn man nicht immer gegen 40-jährige Virgins, die seit Jahren kein Tageslicht gesehen haben, spielen müsste. Das Spiel ist erst spielbar nachdem du mindestens 50 oder mehr Spielstunden reingesteckt hast, da du einfach die Meta Perks (Dead Hard, Borrowed Time,...) brauchst am Anfang um nicht innerhalb von 2 Minuten weg-"getunneled" zu werden. Wenn du dann ca Spielstunden in der Höhe von Tagen in einem, Jahr erreicht hast könntest du dann von dir behaupten das du das Spiel n bissl gut spielen kannst, dann aber gleich gegen eine Nurse mit 3 Blinks oder NemeSUS spielst und du den Sinn des Lebens und warum du das Spiel überhaupt spielst hinterfragst.
Müsst ihr wissen...

Very fun game, either playing with friends or solo, constant updates and balance changes keep the game fair, with lots of maps, killers, survivors and perks. For its price its worth buying even if u dont get the free Epic Games offer. I like the currency mechanics in this game, so that u dont have to spend real money to unlock some killers and survivors, as u can unlock them using some in game points earned by leveling up.

Solo game is terrible:
Severe unbalance,  1 game you get 'god' swf with legacy skins 4k + hours each, and next one is all randoms with 10 hours who cannot do skill checks. Likewise for killers.
Camping, tunneling, slugging is out of control, in general being toxic game counts as high level of skill, and devs do nothing about it. 
Devs only fix few bugs in months and 95% resources is spent to add new $$$ cosmetics and characters.
Oh, and cheaters, there is some. There is in-game report but devs Themselves told that it doesn't work so you don't bother. Cheating is basically allowed.

I preserve my formerly negative review below, because that hasn't changed. I would rather give a "mmmmm depends" review. They are about to address the in-game-currency grind issue somewhat, and for the first time in a long, long while, will be doing a bit of balance.
Now, I still think the game will be somewhat survivor-favoured (yes, I've played survivor, get off my ass). I still think it'll be a grind. The community is still extremely frustrating, disrespectful, and rife with hackers. But I think it is a game worth playing regardless - if you don't have a thin skin. 

You've probably read a bunch of negative reviews already by now.
One minor point you might not have seen:
Moderators locked the steam discussion thread for the "labour of love" award nomination, an hour after it launched. People unanimously commented that dbd didn't deserve that award. 
Meaning the developers would rather silence any opposing voices than actually improve the game.

For all its flaws, this is still a fun game. Don't take it too seriously, and you'll have a much better time. While there is definitely room for improvement in a lot of ways, I do think the devs care about the game they are making.

Also, this is one of the few games I've played where LGBT support doesn't just feel like an attempt at pandering; the devs are clearly allies, and I appreciate that.
